definition: to look far ahead/to look forward (to)
to gaze/to view
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: A lively sense of looking ahead was a part of the american spirit from the beginning .
sentences.chinese: 充滿活力的瞻望前途，從開始就是美國精神的一部分。

sentences.english: I stand semid-footing over the lake.
Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
sentences.chinese: 你要向天觀看，瞻望那高於你的穹蒼。

definition: to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
to look forward to
to look/to raise one's eyes
to lean on sth and gaze into the distance
to raise one's head and look
to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
to stand on tiptoe looking forward to sb or sth
variant of 企望[qi3 wang4]
to recollect
as far as the eye can see
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
to look forward eagerly/to long for
to look carefully
as far as the eye can see
to look forward and back cautiously
watchtower on either side of a city gate/(literary) city/imperial palace
to visit places famous for their scenery
